channel.title: Publication on Aniruddha Bapat
channel.description: Recent content in Publication on Aniruddha Bapat

item.title: Quantum approximate optimization of the long-range Ising model with a trapped-ion quantum simulator
item.description: We show how to classically simulate circuit representations of the Yang-Baxter equation when the generating gate belongs to certain families of solutions.

item.title: Entanglement bounds on the performance of quantum computing architectures
item.description: In this paper, we show that a quantity known as the isoperimetric number establishes a lower bound on the time required to create highly entangled states.

item.title: Unitary entanglement construction in hierarchical networks
item.description: We present numerical and analytical results on the speed at which large entangled states can be created on nearest-neighbor grids and hierarchy graphs. We also present a scheme for performing circuit placement on hierarchical quantum architectures.

item.title: Classical simulation of Yang-Baxter gates
item.description: We show how to classically simulate circuit representations of the Yang-Baxter equation when the generating gate belongs to certain families of solutions.

item.title: Bang-bang control as a design principle for classical and quantum optimization algorithms
item.description: We study the performance of several variational quantum optimization algorithms on two toy constraint satisfaction problem instances, and argue that the type of control strategy can be crucial to success.
